CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1949, p. 13, reads: "Centre Avenue Station Reopens - The racially mixed staff which appears in top left photo looked across the desk at the six white men, one colored women, and one white woman who appears for hearings at Centre Avenue Station on Tuesday morning following the reopening ceremonies at the station Monday night. They were the main reason for the rejoicing in the Negro community at the reopening ceremony for a remodeled 'lockup.'... Bottom center photo: Part of the crowd in the courtroom that witnessed the reopening ceremonies... Other photos by Charles Harris."
TitMainTitle: Crowd, including woman holding photographer's lamps on right, and police officers in doorway in background, in Centre Avenue police station
